versionNotes: Sprint 1 demo — AI-facilitated peer discussion for CST395
title: Sprint 1 Demo: AI-Facilitated Peer Discussion
description: Your partner has written their Sprint 1 reflection on paper. Enter their responses below, then use AI-generated questions to have a deeper conversation together.

questions.prompt: Walk through your 5 Whys chain for your challenge. At which 'why' did you find a design opportunity — something you could change about your environment or system rather than just 'try harder'?
questions.partnerInstructions: Read your partner's written response to the required question carefully, then type it below as accurately as you can. Don't paraphrase — capture their actual words.
questions.placeholder: Type your partner's written response here exactly as they wrote it...
questions.aiContext: This is a Sprint 1 reflection in CST395 (AI-Native Solution Engineering). The student completed a 5 Whys exercise to find a design opportunity in their personal challenge. They should have identified a specific 'why' where they found something they could change about their environment or system rather than relying on willpower. Look for depth of analysis, specificity of the design opportunity, and whether it's truly a system/environment change rather than a willpower-based solution.
questions.discussionPrompt: Use these questions to have a 3-5 minute face-to-face conversation with the author. Take turns — the partner asks, the author responds. Then summarize the key insights below.

questions.prompt: Choose 1 of 2 questions below, then enter your partner's response:
questions.selectorLabel: Which question did your partner respond to?
questionOptions: Complete this formula for your experiment: I know [X] about myself → my friction is [Y] → my experiment does [Z]. Then explain: why wouldn't a generic solution work?
What's the weakest part of your experiment? Where did your self-knowledge fall short, and what would you redesign?
questions.partnerInstructions: First select which question the author chose, then type their written response below.
questions.placeholder: Type your partner's response to their chosen question here...
questions.aiContext: This is a Sprint 1 reflection in CST395 (AI-Native Solution Engineering). The student chose one of two questions: either explaining their self-knowledge → friction → experiment formula and why a generic solution wouldn't work, or identifying the weakest part of their experiment and what they'd redesign. Look for depth of self-knowledge connection, specificity in the friction-to-design link, and honest assessment of experiment weaknesses.
questions.discussionPrompt: Discuss these questions together. Pay attention to specificity and honesty. Summarize your conversation below.

questions.prompt: After discussing both responses with your partner, what is the single most important thing you learned about their growth journey — or about your own — from this conversation?
questions.placeholder: Reflect on the full conversation you just had...
